bill of rights.translation[0].definition: a written statement of the most important rights of the citizens of a country
bill of rights.translation[1].definition: part of the US constitution (=the basic laws of the country that cannot easily be changed) which is a list of the rights of US citizens, for example freedom of speech  (=the right to say what you want to say, including criticizing the government), and freedom of religion. In the original Bill of Rights (1791), ten rights were listed (=ten amendments ), but since then several more have been added.
